content:
Thanks for stopping by!
I am a PhD student at the University of Oxford with Yarin Gal in OATML and Tom Rainforth in OxCSML. I am working on (mostly Bayesian) Deep Learning. More specifically, I am currently looking into active learning, self-attention for deep non-parametric models, and Bayesian deep ensembles. I received an MSc in Physics from Heidelberg University and have spent time studying in Bremen, Darmstadt, Padova, and at University College London.
I am interested in the societal and ethical implications of AI: I have co-authored a book explaining machine learning to a broad audience, discussed the ethics of AI at the Berlin-Brandenburg Academy of Sciences, and gathered real-world field experience at Bosch.
 Download my resumÃ©. --
summary:
Thanks for stopping by!
I am a PhD student at the University of Oxford with Yarin Gal in OATML and Tom Rainforth in OxCSML. I am working on (mostly Bayesian) Deep Learning.

content:
11/21 â€“ We are excited to give a lecture on Non-Parametric Transformers as part of the Stanford Lecture Course ‘CS25: Transformers United’ in November 2021.
10/21 â€“ Excited to announce that Self-Attention Between Datapoints: Going Beyond Individual Input-Output Pairs in Deep Learning has been accepted for publication at NeurIPS 2021.
10/21 â€“ Selected as reviewer for AISTATS 2022.
09/21 â€“ Invited talk at Google Research on Non-Parametric Transformers.
08/21 â€“ I have received a ‘Best Reviewers (Top 10%)’ award for my reviewing at ICML 2021.
08/21 â€“ Invited talk at AI Campus Berlin on Non-Parametric Transformers.
07/21 - Invited talk at Cohere about Non-Parametric Transformers.
06/21 â€“ Selected as reviewer for ICLR 2022.
06/21 â€“Â I have decided to release my 2020 MSc thesis Modelling Videos of Physically Interacting Objects.
06/21 â€“Â Very excited to announce a new-preprint: Self-Attention Between Datapoints: Going Beyond Individual Input-Output Pairs in Deep Learning.
05/21 â€“Â Invited talk at AI Campus Berlin on Active Testing: Sample-Efficient Model Evaluation.
05/21 â€“Â Very excited to announce that Active Testing: Sample-Efficient Model Evaluation, my first paper at OATML Oxford, has been accepted for publication at ICML 2021.
04/21 â€“ Selected as reviewer for NeurIPS 2021.
12/20 â€“ Selected as reviewer for ICML 2021.
11/20 â€“Â Our YouTube series on explaining AI and ML in cooperation with the Federal Agency for Civic Education has launched.
10/20 â€“ Starting my PhD at OATML Oxford with Yarin Gal and Tom Rainforth.
08/20 â€“Â Selected as reviewer for Object Representations for Learning and Reasoning Workshop @ NeurIPS 2020.
05/20 â€“Â Selected as reviewer for Object-Oriented Learning Workshop @ ICML 2020.
03/20 â€“Â Hands-On with AI workshop at Digi-Konferenz organized by Federal Agency for Civic Education in Frankfurt, Germany.
12/19 â€“Â Excited to announce that Structured object-aware physics prediction for video modeling and planning has been accepted to ICLR 2020.
11/19 â€“Â Science-Slam & AI workshop at Tegernsee Science Days.
10/19 â€“Â Our (German) book Wie Maschinen Lernen explaining machine learning in layman’s terms and pretty images has finally been published.
